column4: hmmm, on a 320gb drive, with 3 200gb drives for general storage, what would be a good size for /usr?
i hate trying to arbitrarily pick sizes for partitions
i think the walkthrough tells you how to build a deb for your distro
i don't remember off the top of my head atm
any thoughts on a good size for /usr? ;)
why are you making it a separate partition?
i like to keep things separated
but if you don't use some space you allocate, you've wasted it. if you use more than you allocate, you're screwed
in general, unless you have a good reason, you should stick with a single partition for everything else
the only thing it makes sense to keep separate are /home and /boot, in my opinion
try installing a different distro or upgrading by doing an install from disc with everything on one massive partition, and you'll understand why i do it this way :p
i've installed lots of distros... it's not like i keep /usr across distros
i usually at least keep /usr/local across distros/versions
i hope you at least put /home on a separate partition
i do. but stuff that i need to compile in one distro i may not in another
and even if i do, they may use different gcc, etc.
